lead_paragraph: Cincinnati linebacker A. J. Nicholson was arrested on a domestic violence charge yesterday, the first arrest of a Bengals player since Commissioner Roger Goodell cracked down on misconduct last month.Nicholson was already one of nine Bengals players arrested during a nine-month stretch, turning the team into a prime example of player misconduct. The police in Taylor Mill, Ky., arrested Nicholson after a woman called 911 yesterday afternoon to say that she had been assaulted by Nicholson. He was charged with fourth-degree assault, a misdemeanor.
